summary: This is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing the preparation of a 5K letter for a cooperating witness. The emails discuss whether information about the witness's account, which is relevant to an Office of the Inspector General (OIG) investigation, can be included in the letter, and clarify that the witness was not critical to charging their case and is unlikely to be called as a witness.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, seeking guidance on drafting a 5K letter for a cooperating witness and inquiring about the witness's role in a case.

events.title: Email discussion on 5K letter and OIG investigation
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys correspond about drafting a 5K letter for a cooperating witness, discussing whether to include information about the witness's account relevant to an ongoing OIG investigation.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain between federal prosecutors regarding a 5K letter for a cooperating witness.
The witness's account is considered important background for a future Office of the Inspector General (OIG) report.
The prosecutors confirm they did not rely on any inmates to charge their case and it is highly unlikely any inmate will be called as a witness.
The email discusses the level of secrecy surrounding an OIG investigation and the caution needed when including related information in a 5K letter.
